results.title: Focus on LSD and other psychedelics
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films, Avanti Films and Directions Unlimited
results.brief_description: This film identifies samples of LSD, peyote, DMT, STP, mescaline, psilocybin, hashish and marijuana. A series of situations in which young people advocate use of psychedelics, mostly LSD, is examined giving an opposing point of view. Some of the arguments cover the issues of potential chromosome damage, the ability to better understand oneself while using LSD, and the ability to love others. Written by Max Miller and narrated by Tommy Roe.

results.title: Focus on leisure
results.brief_description: A survey of how the British people spend their leisure time. Today, people have more leisure time than ever before and the film shows scenes of some of the ways in which they spend it. Stress is placed on the fact that more and more people are today utilising their leisure in learning about other occupations and acquiring new interests.

results.title: Focus on India
results.brief_description: An outline of some of the difficulties facing India’s new rulers and the progress being made in many branches of her economy. Among the topics discussed and illustrated are the plans whereby India is attempting to stamp out illiteracy; the attempts being made to weld the many different sects and castes into a single nation; the development of new agricultural and industrial projects.

results.title: Focus on Heroin
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films, Avanti Films and Directions Unlimited
results.brief_description: This film points out the risks of being a heroin addict. Explains that addicts cannot be identified solely with one particular socio-economic level and cannot always be detected by appearance. Addicts and ex-addicts describe the first and subsequent drugs they used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films, Avanti Films and Directions Unlimited

results.title: Focus on France
results.brief_description: Since the end of World War II, the French have been attempting to improve farming methods in their country as part of an overall plan to increase prosperity. This film reviews progress in this direction taking, as an example, a farming community in the Chateau country of the Loire.

results.title: Focus on fat
results.brief_description: A survey of the vital part played by fat in the production of food. Includes whale oil, vegetable oil from coconuts in Ceylon, and palm oil from West Africa.

results.title: Focus on Ethiopia
results.brief_description: A survey of the growth of Ethiopia since the war. Scenes are given of new building, educational and agricultural programs which are now under way. The recent history of the country is traced from the beginning of the 20th century, including newsreel sequences of the Italo-Ethiopian war. Under the leadership of Emperor Haile Selassie the country is being prepared to take an important place in world affairs.

results.title: Focus on downers
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: Vignettes illustrate how barbiturates can lead to death when they cause the user to forget how many they have taken, when they are taken with alcohol or when the user attempts to drive. Questions use by young people, and discusses barbiturate withdrawal.
results.description: Vignettes illustrate how barbiturates can lead to death when they cause the user to forget how many they have taken, when they are taken with alcohol or when the user attempts to drive. Questions use by young people, and discusses barbiturate withdrawal.

results.title: Focus on Canberra
results.brief_description: Shows the picturesque quality of Canberra and the quiet beauty of the environment in which the nerve centre of Australia’s Federal Government is situated. Musical soundtrack, no spoken commentary.
